function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inadequate disinfection and cleaning of hospital equipment and surfaces may lead to the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and other infectious diseases.","Impact":"Increased risk of infection among medical staff and patients in the hospital environment.","Mitigation":"Implement strict disinfection protocols and regular environmental monitoring to ensure effective disinfection of hospital equipment and surfaces.","Technologies":"Use of advanced disinfection technologies such as UV-C disinfection systems and ozone generators for air and surface disinfection.","People":"Medical staff, patients in the hospital environment.","Owner":"Hospital administrators, infection control teams."},{"Description":"Transformation of general hospital wards into temporary isolation wards may lead to concerns about infection control and environmental safety.","Impact":"Potential risk of inadequate infection control measures and environmental safety in temporary isolation wards.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive environmental monitoring assessments to identify and address concerns related to infection control and environmental safety in temporary isolation wards.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring technologies for air and surface quality assessment.","People":"Patients, medical staff, and visitors in temporary isolation wards.","Owner":"Hospital administrators, infection control teams."},{"Description":"Generation of respiratory aerosols from medical ventilators increases the risk of occupationally acquired infection among healthcare personnel.","Impact":"Increased risk of healthcare personnel acquiring infections from respiratory aerosols generated by medical ventilators.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to minimize aerosol generation, improve ventilation systems, and provide adequate personal protective equipment for healthcare personnel.","Technologies":"Improved ventilator designs to minimize aerosol generation, advanced ventilation systems, and high-efficiency particulate air (HEPA) filters.","People":"Healthcare personnel working with medical ventilators.","Owner":"Hospital administrators, medical device manufacturers."}]}
